title.narrative: PAK141 2014 Floods: Assistance to the Rain and Flood-Affected Families in Azad Kashmir, Punjab and S

description.narrative: To minimize vulnerabilities and immediate food insecurity of target 2,000 flood affected families through provision of emergency food items for three months in Bagh, Haveli and Poonch Districts of AJK. To provide NFI packages to 1,000 and Shelter packages to 400 flood affected families in Bagh, Haveli and Poonch districts. To provide Curative and Preventive health care services with provision of essential free medicines to 3,000 families (22,200 individuals) through Mobile Health Units (MHUs), Hydraulic Mobile Health Units (HMHU), as well as through mobile laboratory in Bagh, Haveli and Poonch districts of Azad Jammu and Kashmir.

Update 28/01/15: CWS will be able to reach 250 more families, each beneficiary family will be provided with CFW opportunity worth PKR 12,000/-. A total of 10 communal infrastructure related schemes will be rehabilitated. At least 350 families will indirectly benefit from the rehabilitated schemes under CFW. CWS proposes to provide primary health care services to the affected people of the target areas focusing mainly on women and children. Preventive and curative health care services will also be provided through two mobile health units in the affected areas where access to primary health care is difficult. The food package is keeping in view the Sphere Common Standards i.e. for food items it should meet the nutritional requirement of 2,100 Kcal (kilocalories) per person per day, and will be sufficient for one month for an average family of 7 to 8 persons, the same standard compositions will also be applied for NFI and Shelter kits packages.
